comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
This is the sole NA-44. A company demonstrator, it fell into the light bomber category, with its 900 hp Wright R-1820 Cyclone engine, three guns and bomb racks. Folowing a successful sales tour of South America, the aircraft was purchased by the RCAF, who used it until war's end. Stationed at Trenton, Ontario, it was known as the Jeep or sometimes as the Super Harvard. It could outfly the Hurricane fighters stationed alongside it.

Doug MacPhail
